# Google Keep Clone

<p align="center">
  <img src="data:image/png;base64," alt="Google Keep Clone Logo" width="200"/>
</p>

Google Keep Clone is a delightful note-taking app built with Flutter and Firebase, designed to replicate the simplicity and usability of Google Keep. Capture your thoughts, make to-do lists, and stay organized seamlessly.

## Table of Contents
- [Introduction](#introduction)
- [Features](#features)
- [Getting Started](#getting-started)
- [Screenshots](#screenshots)
- [Tech Stack](#tech-stack)
- [Contributing](#contributing)

## Introduction

Google Keep Clone is more than just a clone; it's a feature-rich note-taking app that brings the convenience of Google Keep into the Flutter and Firebase ecosystem. Whether you're a casual note-taker or a meticulous planner, this app is tailored to meet your organizational needs.

## Features

- **Create and Edit Notes:** Easily jot down your thoughts and edit them as needed.
- **Checklists:** Make to-do lists and keep track of your tasks.
- **Colorful Labels:** Organize your notes with customizable labels and colors.
- **Firebase Integration:** Store your notes securely using Firebase Cloud Firestore.
- **Real-time Sync:** Changes are reflected in real-time across devices.
- **Authentication:** Secure your notes with Firebase Authentication.

(Add more features as needed)

## Getting Started

These instructions will guide you through setting up the Google Keep Clone app on your local machine for development purposes.

### Prerequisites

- [Flutter](https://flutter.dev/) installed on your machine
- Firebase project set up (Follow [Firebase documentation](https://firebase.google.com/docs/flutter/setup))

### Installation

1. Clone the repository:

    ```bash
    git clone https://github.com/yourusername/google-keep-clone.git
    ```

2. Change directory:

    ```bash
    cd google-keep-clone
    ```

3. Install dependencies:

    ```bash
    flutter pub get
    ```

4. Set up Firebase:
    - Follow the Firebase setup guide for Flutter: [Add Firebase to your Flutter app](https://firebase.flutter.dev/docs/overview)

5. Run the app:

    ```bash
    flutter run
    ```



## Tech Stack

- **Flutter:** Frontend UI framework.
- **Firebase:** Backend and real-time database.
- **Provider:** State management for Flutter apps.

## Contributing

We welcome contributions from the community! If you find any issues or have suggestions, please open an issue or submit a pull request.
